meanings.definition: To direct or order someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher was enjoining the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The manager enjoining the staff to attend the meeting promptly.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was enjoining its owner to play fetch in the park.
meanings.sent4: The conductor enjoining the musicians to start the performance with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The coach enjoining the team to give their best effort in the game.

meanings.sent1: The sign clearly enjoining visitors from entering the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The law enjoining smoking in public places for health reasons.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child enjoining his friends from eating the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: The wizard enjoining the villagers from entering the forbidden forest.
meanings.sent5: The judge enjoining the defendant from contacting the plaintiff during the trial.
